20101227021648.000|20101227021650.000|TR0|KING:  It's brilliant.

20101227021700.000|20101227021702.000|TR0|of my favorite shows.
20101227021702.000|20101227021704.000|TR0|
20101227021704.000|20101227021706.000|TR0|KING:  How did "Seinfeld" come about?
20101227021706.000|20101227021708.000|TR0|
20101227021708.000|20101227021709.000|TR0|SEINFELD:  It came about because NBC had 
20101227021709.000|20101227021711.000|TR0|talked to me about doing a show, and I was 
20101227021711.000|20101227021713.000|TR0|standing in catch a rising star on first 
20101227021713.000|20101227021715.000|TR0|avenue in 1988 with Larry David, and I 
20101227021715.000|20101227021717.000|TR0|said, so NBC is talking to me about you 
20101227021717.000|20101227021719.000|TR0|know that they might want to do something, 
20101227021719.000|20101227021721.000|TR0|and I can't think of anything to do.
20101227021721.000|20101227021723.000|TR0|
20101227021723.000|20101227021725.000|TR0|So, then, we go across the street to a 
20101227021725.000|20101227021727.000|TR0|Korean deli, and we're buying some food to 
20101227021727.000|20101227021729.000|TR0|eat, some, you know, junk, you know, chips 
20101227021729.000|20101227021731.000|TR0|and things, and we start making fun of

20101227025041.000|20101227025043.000|TR0|ANDERSON COOPER, CNN ANCHOR:  I'm Anderson 
20101227025043.000|20101227025044.000|TR0|Cooper.  All year, we've been introducing 
20101227025044.000|20101227025046.000|TR0|you to our CNN Heroes, everyday people 
20101227025046.000|20101227025048.000|TR0|changing the world.  Today, we're 
20101227025048.000|20101227025050.000|TR0|announcing the top ten CNN Heroes for 2010.
20101227025050.000|20101227025052.000|TR0|
20101227025052.000|20101227025054.000|TR0|The honorees are, in alphabetical order, 
20101227025054.000|20101227025056.000|TR0|Guadeloupe Arizpe De La Vega. She's 
20101227025056.000|20101227025058.000|TR0|providing health care in the increasingly 
20101227025058.000|20101227025100.000|TR0|violent Juarez, Mexico.  Susan Burton, her 
20101227025100.000|20101227025102.000|TR0|re-entry program helps female ex-convicts 
20101227025102.000|20101227025104.000|TR0|get back on their feet.
20101227025104.000|20101227025106.000|TR0|
20101227025106.000|20101227025108.000|TR0|Linda Fondren, she's brought her community 
20101227025108.000|20101227025110.000|TR0|together to shed pounds. Anuradha Koirala 
20101227025110.000|20101227025112.000|TR0|rescues and rehabilitates Nepali girls 
20101227025112.000|20101227025113.000|TR0|from sex trafficking.
20101227025113.000|20101227025115.000|TR0|
20101227025115.000|20101227025117.000|TR0|Narayanan Krishnan serves three meals a 
20101227025117.000|20101227025119.000|TR0|day to homeless by hand.
20101227025119.000|20101227025121.000|TR0|
20101227025121.000|20101227025123.000|TR0|Magnus MacFarlane-Barrow feeds more than 
20101227025123.000|20101227025125.000|TR0|400,000 kids every day.
20101227025125.000|20101227025127.000|TR0|
20101227025127.000|20101227025129.000|TR0|Harmon Parker build bridges connecting 
20101227025129.000|20101227025131.000|TR0|Kenyans with life-changing resources.
20101227025131.000|20101227025133.000|TR0|
20101227025133.000|20101227025135.000|TR0|Aki Ra restores safety by finding and 
20101227025135.000|20101227025137.000|TR0|diffusing land mines planted by the Khmer 
20101227025137.000|20101227025139.000|TR0|Rouge.
20101227025139.000|20101227025141.000|TR0|

20101227025142.000|20101227025144.000|TR0|prosperity for rural Kenyans with his

20101227025152.000|20101227025154.000|TR0|service.
